definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]

sentences.english: That good steel must be thoroughly tempered what strength can be more weather-beaten.
sentences.chinese: 千锤百炼才能够磨炼出好钢，饱经风霜才能更强。

sentences.english: I will exercise my soul in three ways.
sentences.chinese: 我会用三种方法来磨炼我的灵魂。

sentences.english: Sometimes we have to outlive our history.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，我们还得经受生活的磨炼。

sentences.english: No man ever lived a right life who had not been chastened by a woman's love.
sentences.chinese: 没有男人不受女人爱的磨炼而能过平正的生活。

sentences.english: Homework is to build your nerve. You need some cunning.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业是为了磨炼你的勇气，锻炼你的灵敏度。

sentences.english: Nowadays many weight-watchers would like to go to the gym.
sentences.chinese: 现在有很多胖人喜好到健身房去磨炼。

sentences.english: Its not just the physical endeavor either.
sentences.chinese: 攀岩并不仅仅是体力上的磨炼与考验。

sentences.english: Solo eventually joined the Imperial Academy, to better himself and his piloting skills.
sentences.chinese: 为了提高自己，磨炼飞行技术，汉加入了帝国军校。

sentences.english: The difficulty is the best helper for steeling will.
sentences.chinese: 磨炼意志最好的帮手是困难。

sentences.english: Should we really demand that the guy who checks ticket stubs at the movie theater hones his craft?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们真的必须要求一个剧场检票员磨炼他的手艺？

sentences.english: Difficult circumstances can temper one's will.
sentences.chinese: 艰苦的环境能磨炼人的意志。

definition: to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to be tempered into a steel
to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
